{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3406049,"name":"Max C (10903)","username":"MaxedPC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T18:39:17.654Z","cooked":"

Hello! I am working on a project for my team of implementing a full vision processing software suite specifically for FRC, designed to combat the outrageous prices of systems like Limelight. What features would you guys like to see in vision processing software that would have you and your team completely sold? I will likely release this software for free within the next few months to comply with FIRST regulations, so keep a look out! Thanks for your suggestions!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T18:39:17.654Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":47,"reads":355,"readers_count":354,"score":371.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Max C (10903)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67157,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3406051,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T18:43:16.056Z","cooked":"

Are you aware of PhotonVision? You might want to consider contributing to that project rather than starting from scratch.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T18:43:16.056Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":352,"readers_count":351,"score":175.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://photonvision.org/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"PhotonVision","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/2","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406057,"name":"Max C (10903)","username":"MaxedPC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T18:58:44.007Z","cooked":"

@Peter_Johnson We are aware of PhotonVision and we have been using that for the past few years. I want to create one that is a bit more user friendly, and I think it will be a good learning experience. Thanks for the tip though!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T19:00:46.365Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":339,"readers_count":338,"score":107.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Max C (10903)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67157,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406065,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T19:21:44.318Z","cooked":"

While green field engineering is fun, contributing to existing OSS projects is an even better learning experience, imo. You learn how to collaborate on a generally mature codebase with lots of users, which has a much different feel and will be more applicable to basically every software project you work on professionally.

If you are going to do a ground-up rewrite, make sure you start by detailing what your predecessors got right, what they got wrong, and what the goals of the successor are. Having a clear vision with specific knowledge of what came before lets you avoid reinventing the wheel poorly, or repeating the same mistakes. Here’s some example questions to ask:

  • What was the old project trying to do?
  • What painpoints does the old project have, and why did they occur?
  • Why did the old project choose the technologies it did? (e.g., addressing requirements, developer skillsets, accrual of technical debt over time)
  • Are there new technologies that would make what the old project was trying to do easier?
  • What can the new project do better, and how specifically would it accomplish that?
  • What requirements would potential users impose on the new project?
  • Should the new project be backwards-compatible with the old project? This makes it easier to capture users of the old project by easing migration, but it can lock you into legacy design decisions. Do those design decisions conflict with the new project’s goals?
","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T19:41:45.710Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":309.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Tyler Veness","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":67157,"username":"MaxedPC","name":"Max C (10903)","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":17}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/4","custom_user_title":"WPILib controls | Choreo optimizer backend","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":17,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406073,"name":"Max C (10903)","username":"MaxedPC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T19:52:32.927Z","cooked":"

Wow! These are some great questions to ask myself! To be more specific, the project is designed for RPIs to use webcams to detect game pieces. I was playing around and testing new algorithms for this detection, and I stumbled upon one that seems to be more reliable and efficient than those used in PhotonVision. I tried to make my algorithm somewhat compatible with PV, but like you said, it conflicted with many of my goals, so I ditched it. Now, I am working on developing a front-end for that algorithm, and, while I do have some of my own requirements, I want to see what the rest of the community has in mind as well. Thank you for your reply - I will keep these questions in mind when developing future software.

Hi, this summer I’m working on improving all around support for AI object detection in PV. I was wondering if this algorithm could be characterized as a ‘deep neural network’ or does it lean towards the classical colored shape stuff?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T20:26:25.597Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":267,"readers_count":266,"score":73.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Christopher Mahoney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67157,"username":"MaxedPC","name":"Max C (10903)","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58493,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5881 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/6","custom_user_title":"5881 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406083,"name":"Max C (10903)","username":"MaxedPC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T20:35:32.998Z","cooked":"

It uses the floodfill algorithm, so it is not quite a DNN. I would like to make one however - that could be quite interesting. What would you be attempting to solve with your model?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T20:35:32.998Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":263,"readers_count":262,"score":57.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Max C (10903)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58493,"username":"Alextopher","name":"Christopher Mahoney","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9e8a1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67157,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406096,"name":"Christopher Mahoney","username":"Alextopher","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T20:51:35.194Z","cooked":"

PV currently has support for object detection using a YOLOv5 model using the Orange PI 5 NPU. My goal is to expand the platform support (CUDA and RPi 5 AI Kit), grow the number of supported models, and make the user experience better.

It uses the floodfill algorithm

Sounds cool!

What would you be attempting to solve with your model?

AI object detection has become very good over the last few years, and projects like YOLO have brought it into the world of embedded. The NOTE model this year ran at ~30 fps with ~25 ms latency.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T20:51:52.472Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":263,"readers_count":262,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Christopher Mahoney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67157,"username":"MaxedPC","name":"Max C (10903)","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58493,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5881 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/8","custom_user_title":"5881 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406102,"name":"Max C (10903)","username":"MaxedPC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T20:58:47.369Z","cooked":"

Wow! That sounds like a fantastic project. Have you seen the Hailo AI HAT for the RPI? It sounds like that could be an interesting addition to your project. If you have any ideas for what you want to see in a VP software, please let me know! Thanks!

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T20:58:47.369Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":62.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Max C (10903)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58493,"username":"Alextopher","name":"Christopher Mahoney","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/9e8a1a/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67157,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406111,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T21:36:15.457Z","cooked":"

I would definitely like to see Opi5 and NN support for object detection. The base hardware config I prefer for vision is an Opi5 with 2 cameras - one for tags, one for objects, with the option to add a third camera for tags. OV9781 and OV9782 are my preferred cameras.

PV does this perfectly fine right now, but if you have something more optimized and stable I’d definitely try it out.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T21:36:49.116Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":49.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406136,"name":"Max C (10903)","username":"MaxedPC","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/71c47a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T22:57:15.273Z","cooked":"

Thank you very much for your suggestions! As of now, my software only supports one camera and no tags, but I only started working on it about a week ago so I have a long way to go. Both the Opi and the OV cams are supported as of now, though the OV cams require an extra 5 lines of code to setup. I really appreciate it, and I will get back to you ASAP!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T22:57:15.273Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":204,"readers_count":203,"score":50.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468399,"topic_slug":"what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software","display_username":"Max C (10903)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67157,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-teams-want-to-see-in-vision-processing-software/468399/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406199,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-08T01:29:10.162Z","cooked":"
Max C (10903):

What features would you guys like to see in vision processing software that would have you and your team completely sold?

From watching many teams evaluate both PV and LL over the course of the last season, it seemed like many who tried PV and switched back to LL during the season did so not because of performance or features, but because of reliability. I think a lot of the root causes of failures with PV didn’t come from PV itself but rather on the hardware side (almost all were using the OP5 + OV9281 combos). There’s a certain amount of “just works” that comes with the LL being a single unit.

I’m not sure how much you can do purely in software to improve this over PV, but if you’re looking for what “sells” teams on paying for a LL, that’s it.

This is great information. Thank you so much. I am writing everything on the Pi side in Python for flexibility - I may shift to C++ at some point. I am keeping it at an absolute bare minimum for reliability, and also for performance, and as of now, it works perfectly with OP and OV cameras. I will try to keep it as simple as possible!

We’re using PhotonVision on a Minisforum mini PC and have been pretty happy with it.

We’re also working on bringing AI inference support on more generic hardware to PhotonVision using a PyTorch script and gRPC.

Was there anything in particular about how photon’s code is structured that made adding a new kind of pipeline unworkable? There’s a lot of boilerplate involved (see the RKNN PR, the OG Apriltag PR), but there’s not a ton we can do right now to reduce it.

Max C (10903):

RPIs to use webcams

I have some experience using OpenCV, WPILib Camera Server on Windows and RPi, and PhotonVision. It appears to me that WPILib and PhotonVision people want their code to work with essentially any camera that teams happen to use and to that goal they appear to have spent an inordinate amount of energy getting so many different cameras to work. OpenCV not nearly so.

You can simplify as LimeLight did and pick a winner for a camera (and supplier) but now that camera is not available (for the global shutter retrofit).

Interesting. For all of the (limited) experience I have with OpenCV, I have never had a camera not work with it. Maybe this is something that I release the software that works with everything I have access to and users submit issues when a camera does not work? It would be sad to have to rely on the user that much but I do not own every camera in the world.
